unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Sparking Interest in Kerala Homes**
normalised: energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies sparking interest in kerala homes

unnormalised: Thiruvananthapuram: Forget Onam Sadhya, this year Keralites are serving up solar power! New subsidies on rooftop solar panels are making waves across the state, especially after the Kerala State Electricity Board (KSEB) announced an extension until December 31st.
normalised: thiruvananthapuram: forget onam sadhya, this year keralites are serving up solar power! new subsidies on rooftop solar panels are making waves across the state, especially after the kerala state electricity board (K S E B) announced an extension until december thirty first.

unnormalised: Households can now avail subsidies up to 40% for systems up to 3 kW, and 20% for larger installations. Think of it as a Diwali bonus for your electricity bill!
normalised: households can now avail subsidies up to forty percent for systems up to three kilowatt, and twenty percent for larger installations. think of it as a diwali bonus for your electricity bill!

unnormalised: "We're seeing a huge surge in inquiries," says Mr. Nair, a local solar installer in Kochi. "People are tired of those hefty summer bills. Plus, everyone wants to do their bit for the environment."
normalised: "we're seeing a huge surge in inquiries," says mister nair, a local solar installer in kochi. "people are tired of those hefty summer bills. plus, everyone wants to do their bit for the environment."

unnormalised: The scheme aims to add 100 MW of rooftop solar capacity across Kerala. Imagine all that clean energy!
normalised: the scheme aims to add one hundred megawatt of rooftop solar capacity across kerala. imagine all that clean energy!

unnormalised: Applications are straightforward, and KSEB is offering assistance throughout the process. Forget queuing up for hours; it's mostly online now.
normalised: applications are straightforward, and K S E B is offering assistance throughout the process. forget queuing up for hours; it's mostly online now.

unnormalised: So, ditch the biryani takeout for one weekend, invest in solar, and enjoy lower electricity bills for years to come. Who knows, maybe next year's Onam feast will be entirely powered by the sun! Time to go green, Kerala!
normalised: so, ditch the biryani takeout for one weekend, invest in solar, and enjoy lower electricity bills for years to come. who knows, maybe next year's onam feast will be entirely powered by the sun! time to go green, kerala!
